As far as I understand, JoolÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s atmosphere starts at 200 km over the surface. When IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m between 200 and 1000, the ship doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t actually experience any acceleration, its orbit is stable. Edited June 3, 2015 by Teilnehmer
I had the same problem yesterday, I keep getting the "You cannot warp when the vessel is under acceleration" message. Still haven't figured it out.
There was a thread about this last week, and many people, including myself, have encountered this. Not sure what causes it, unfortunately.
Strangely, I saw the same thing with my Jool satellite, and after a few orbits it actually disappeared.

I literally saw jool bending my trajectory while doing a pass. Normally you would expect a smooth curve but this wasn't like that. My trajectory literally looked like it was getting pulled towards jool at the closest point then going back up again . At that moment it said that i was accelerating too.
FWIW there is a bugtracker issue on this already.

FWIW there is a bugtracker issue on this already.

Indeed.
